abstract: An obscure London firm may determine whether Jamie Dimon keeps his dual role as chief executive and chairman of JPMorgan Chase.
snippet: An obscure London firm may determine whether Jamie Dimon keeps his dual role as chief executive and chairman of JPMorgan Chase.

headline.main: Small Firm Could Turn the Vote on Dimon
headline.print_headline: Small Firm Could Turn The Vote On Dimon

byline.original: By Susanne Craig and Jessica Silver-Greenberg

abstract: An obscure London firm may decide whether Jamie Dimon remains both C.E.O. and chairman of JPMorgan Chase. | Kleiner Perkins is adjusting its strategy after hitting a rough patch. | Chrysler provides a lesson in how deals struck in haste can come back to haunt. | Yahoo has met with executives of Hulu, according to a report.
snippet: An obscure London firm may decide whether Jamie Dimon remains both C.E.O. and chairman of JPMorgan Chase. | Kleiner Perkins is adjusting its strategy after hitting a rough patch. | Chrysler provides a lesson in how deals struck in haste can come b...
lead_paragraph: A little-known firm in London could play a crucial role in determining the fate of Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase. The firm, Governance for Owners, has been tasked with voting the shares of BlackRock, the bank’s largest shareholder, on the question of whether to strip Mr. Dimon of his role as chairman, Susanne Craig and Jessica Silver-Greenberg report in DealBook.

abstract: To Anne Simpson, the Calpers pension plan’s director for corporate governance, the move is rooted in the belief that systemically important institutions need plenty of oversight.
snippet: To Anne Simpson, the Calpers pension plan’s director for corporate governance, the move is rooted in the belief that systemically important institutions need plenty of oversight.
lead_paragraph: As shareholders consider whether to press for splitting JPMorgan Chase’s top two roles, one big investor has made it very clear where it stands.

headline.main: Calpers Calls JPMorgan’s Combined Top Roles a ‘Fundamental Conflict’

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
